message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

This paper focuses on temporal localization of actions in videos, which is a task commonly studied in computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) communities. The proposed method involves cross-modal matching of text and video representations, which is also relevant to multimedia (cs.MM) research. The use of regression to output action boundary results suggests a machine learning (cs.AI) approach, and the joint modeling of text and video features is a common technique in deep learning (cs.LG).
